title: Rustc panics on incremental build

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body: ### Code Happens when running `cargo run` and `cargo build` but *not* `cargo check` on [this archive](https://eldred.fr/rsgbasm.tar.bz2). Does not reproduce anymore after `cargo clean`, so it's likely to be an incremental problem. Here is [the original source code](https://github.com/ISSOtm/rsgbasm/tree/5a7cb4e44dc81ed250b50ad7c282e8e8aceb86e0). (Note: I uploaded this file on my GitHub Pages, and it's just below the file size limit, so I'd like to be able to take it down as soon as possible.) ### Meta ``` issotm@sheik-kitty ~/rsgbasm% rustc --version --verbose [master|✔] rustc 1.48.0 binary: rustc commit-hash: unknown commit-date: unknown host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.48.0 LLVM version: 11.0 ``` Due to the nature of the bug, it's impossible to reproduce on nightly. ### Error output ``` issotm@sheik-kitty ~/rsgbasm% RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build [master|✔] Compiling rsgbasm v0.1.0 (/home/issotm/rsgbasm) warning: unused import: `Mul` --> src/expression.rs:2:23 | 2 | use std::ops::{BitOr, Mul, Neg, Shl}; | ^^^ | = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default warning: unreachable expression --> src/expression.rs:13:9 | 12 | unimplemented!(); | ----------------- any code following this expression is unreachable 13 | self | ^^^^ unreachable expression | = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 99312 but the index is 699444', /build/rust/src/rustc-1.48.0-src/compiler/rustc_query_system/src/dep_graph/graph.rs:1110:15 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /build/rust/src/rustc-1.48.0-src/library/std/src/panicking.rs:483 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /build/rust/src/rustc-1.48.0-src/library/core/src/panicking.rs:85 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check at /build/rust/src/rustc-1.48.0-src/library/core/src/panicking.rs:62 3: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_previous_green 4: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::try_mark_green_and_read 5: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::ensure_query_impl 6: rustc_session::utils::::time 7: rustc_session::utils::::time 8: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 9: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::analysis>::compute 10: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 11: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 12: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 13: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 14: rustc_interface::passes::QueryContext::enter 15: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 16: rustc_span::with_source_map 17: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.48.0 running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack warning: 2 warnings emitted error: could not compile `rsgbasm` To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
